titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Benjamin F. Holman Papers, 1966-1977
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Susan L. Buseck; machine-readable finding aid created by James Lake

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-06-03T16:44-0700

change.item: June 3, 2016: Revised to update with photocard catalog <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120730" era="ce">July 30, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Benjamin F. did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, racial incident case reports, other reports, pamphlets, press releases, and clippings, relating to desegregation of schools and other facilities in the U.S.; racial or ethnic friction involving black, Hispanic, American Indian and other minority communities; and efforts of the Community Relations Service to resolve such situations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Collection is open for research.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Benjamin F. Holman papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Postgraduate work at University of Chicago, Illinois
Reporter, assignment editor, CBS News, New York City
Assistant director for media relations, Community Relations Service, United States Department of Justice, Washington
Professor of journalism, University of Maryland

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Clippings collected from various newspapers, arranged chronologically

did.unittitle: COMMUNITY RELATIONS SERVICE (CRS) INTERNAL OFFICE FILE,

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Case reports, memoranda, office documents, rosters, speeches and writings, arranged alphabetically by physical form

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Letters and memoranda with individuals and agencies outside the Federal government and with departments and individuals within the Federal government but outside the Justice Department, arranged chronologically

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Articles, memoranda, press releases, reports, speeches, arranged alphabetically by office or position

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Affidavits, articles, biographical sketches, clippings, correspondence, daily schedule, memoranda, office records, pamphlets, schedules, speeches, travel itineraries, arranged alphabetically by physical form

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Annual reports, cartoons, clippings, congressional records and legislation, correspondence, handbooks, memoranda, office records, pamphlets, reports, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: COMMUNITY RELATIONS SERVICE INTERNAL OFFICE FILE,
Associate Director, Includes a memorandum about the American Indian Movement convention at Standing Rock Sioux Reservation
Chief Counsel, Includes weekly reports on desegregation activities and a memorandum about the Louisville desegregation case
Goldenrods (memoranda from Holman to the staff), For topics, see appendix
Speeches and writings by CRS officials other than Holman
Correspondence with agencies and individuals outside the Federal government
Includes William J. Raspberry and Roy Innis
Correspondence with departments and individuals within the Federal government but outside the Justice Department
Speeches and writings by Justice Department officials other than Holman. Includes speeches by Richard G. Kleindienst, Richard L. Thornburgh and William B. Saxbe
Attorney General, Topics include student unrest, desegregation in Boston, Detroit and other schools and American Indians. Includes weekly reports on significant developments nationwide
Deputy Attorney General, Topics include the IMAGE project, American Indians, Mexican-Americans and Boston school desegregation
Law Enforcement Assistance Administration (LEAA), Includes a study of LEAA and a critique of the study
United States Attorneys. Includes memoranda about civil disturbances in Illinois
General. Includes correspondence, memoranda, clippings, pamphlets, daily schedule, articles and affidavits regarding staff complaints
General and Includes materials on Holman's reappointment as director and copy of a speech by Holman to the Civil Rights Oversight Subcommittee on the proposed budget cuts for CRS
Includes article by Holman on mediation
Includes copy of a speech by Holman on minority/majority coalitions
Includes letter from Jimmy Carter accepting Holman's resignation
Speeches and writings. Topics include desegregation, CRS, black community and press, LEAA, racial conflict, police, Hispanics Americans, Black colleges, civil rights, racism and the media
General. Includes correspondence, schedules and background information
Travel notes, Includes itineraries, correspondence and background information
History of CRS for Johnson Library Project
Desegregation handbook, Dayton public schools, Ohio
Mark Twain Junior High School for gifted and talented, New York
Resource book from CRS desegregation workshop,
Planning, Policy and Program Development, Office of (OPD)
Wounded Knee, Pine Ridge Sioux Reservation
